value: I came across this really provocative
quote by a man named Theodore Dalrymple
who is British he's a writer he was a
doctor and he'd spent most of his career
practicing medicine with disenfranchised
and impoverished populations in Britain
and the quote that made me want to make
a video was he was speaking about
political correctness and it's it's
what's the word
political correctness is it is a
dictatorship of the mind really that's
my word it's not his I don't want to say
any speak on his behalf but it's
fascinating because if you've read the
book 1984 by George Orwell honestly you
have to be ready for it I read it late
in life some people read it when they're
kids and I can't probably not anymore
because they would see our current
culture for what it really is but hmm I
read 1984 when I was a grown up adult
and I was so depressed it's the most
depressing book I've ever read and I
read a book called Angela's Ashes by
Frank McCourt if you've never read that
that up until 1984 that was the most
depressing book I'd ever read
anyway 1984 on the concept of Newspeak
where they've pretty much reduced the
language to a point where you can't even
express complex thoughts or dissents
or negativity because they've just taken
away the words that we would use to
express those things so political
correctness to me and I say this as
someone who was completely wooed in the
early days by political correctness and
I'm talking two years ago before it got
insane I thought there was a place for
political correctness I've changed my
mind on that
six years ago I viewed it censorship and
I am wholeheartedly opposed to
censorship in every form in every way
yes even really terrible things I oppose
censorship
okay
rambling back to my points Theodore
Dalrymple said and bear with me you're
gonna read it
political correctness is communist
propaganda a rich small in my study of
communist societies I came to the
conclusion that the purpose of communist

and therefore the less it corresponded
to reality the better when people here's
the part when people are forced to
remain silent when they are being told
the most obvious lies or even worse when
they are forced to repeat the lies to
themselves they lose once and for all
their sense of probity to assent to
obvious lies is to cooperate with evil
and in some small way to become evil
oneself one standing to resist anything
is best eroded and even destroyed a
society is emasculated liars a society
of emasculated liars is easy to control
I think if you examine political
correctness it has the same effect and
is intended to
first of all there's a word in there
that I had heard lots of times but
didn't really know the definition of so
I looked it up probity probity means
one's personal honesty and integrity
isn't it interesting that in today's day
and age I mean have you heard that word
before possibly you have we're quite an
educated group in this community and
we're curious so maybe you had already

didn't know for sure what it meant
probity so he's saying one sense of
honesty and integrity is damaged
integrity is so vital
no one can take your integrity from you
but you I don't care what they do to you
you are in control of your integrity
you're in control of your entire
internal landscape
political correctness
is eroding our ability to stand in who
we really are because it's taking away

it is shutting down arguments before
they start because because apparently
you've said something against the
political correct police
we can't live like that do you not see
as I saw in that quote that this is how
scapegoats
are born we are the ones who won't
repeat obvious lies or accept them
that's who we are
yes that happened most of the time in
our families
this is why when they do profiles of
victims of bullying they say bullies
pick on the strong the creative the
intelligent the grounded they pick on
those people because those people are
not going to go along with obvious lies
they're not going to repeat them and
this system that we live under this
narcissistic sociopathic system that we
live under cannot survive with people
who don't go along with the lies it
needs a balance in the other direction
it needs weak minded weak spirited
people who have lost their probity what
I would love to see from my fellow human
beings
is to maintain your probity your honesty
and your integrity to lean your body
against the gears of the machine to

you already have it in you if you're

that we can be this the bulwark
